Description: Terracotta figure of woman with left hand against chest, right leg is advanced. Wearing Greek dress and stephane. Mould-made, hollow, but lacks definition. White coating and traces of paint. Light clay with black core. Three fragments, with legs broken from knee. Worn.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: Dated by Edgar as 5th century BC Greek in his unpublished catalogue, but as 'Archaic' in original register. Date based on Edgar notes and description.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DB.417) (Phase 3)
